column4: hi, one friend of mine shut down his X by entering sudo /etc/init.d/gdm stop, now he cant do anything in command line and ctrl+alt+backspace and ctrl+alt+f7 didn't do anything
will the ctrl + alt + f2 work?
ctrl+alt+f2 log in as user then type sudo /etc/init.d/gdm start
if that doesnt work, try sudo reboot
it seems the problem is solved :) until now... very thank you

he's trying to install a Nvidia drivers for his amd machine, the name of the file is NVIDIA-Linux-x86-173.14.12-pkg1.run. after he run this file, it appears this error: ERROR: Unable to build the NVIDIA Kernel modul
the version is the 8.10, i think, it's not mine, but one friend of mine
Ubuntu should have nvidia drivers in the packages see http://packages.ubuntu.com
he is relating me the ocurrences by msn in his windows desktop
we tried that, but nothing works..:( his Nvidia is a FX5700
